item.title: Abigail add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Abigail add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "A baby is God's opinion that the world should go on." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Abigail add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Abigail add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Abigail add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Abigail add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The smallest feline is a masterpiece." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Abigail add a quote by J.R. Ward
item.description: "I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened." -- J.R. Ward
